titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Thomas Chapin Papers, 1870s-1999 (bulk 1979-1999) RL.00211

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-28 14:10:34 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

Also, some of the materials in this collection are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use and/or are housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Thomas Chapin Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Thomas Chapin Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift and purchase in 1999 and 2001-2003.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Lisa Stark and Kate Crassons
Completed November 12, 2001
Additions processed by Stacey Clarke, Danielle McGregor
Last updated December 11, 2003
Encoded by Kate Crassons, Ruth E. Bryan, Danielle McGregor and Elizabeth Arnold
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jazz saxophonist/flutist and composer (b. 1957 d. 1998) from Connecticut. Musical director of Lionel Hampton's orchestra and then leader of and participant in other ensembles, including his own trio.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection (100 items, 2.5 linear feet; dated 1979-1998) contains audio cassettes and compositions by Thomas Chapin, as well as clippings, programs, memorial messages, and other items about him. Technical Services staff may need to make use copies of audio cassettes before use. No container list was created for this accession. (99-355)

The addition to the collection (60 items, 2.5 linear feet; dated 1981-1999) includes published materials on Chapin or featuring his music. There are publicity materials; scrapbook items, such as programs or clippings; articles about Chapin from the internet and elsewhere; copies of original scores; compact discs; phonograph records; genealogical information, and other biographical information about him and his trio. Technical Services staff may need to make use copies of sound recordings before use. No container list was created for this accession. (99-0467)

The addition to the collection (15300 items, 29.40 linear feet; dated 1870s-1998, bulk 1980-1997) comprises primarily correspondence; financial records; scrapbooks, graphic materials (98 color photographs, 1 color slide, 6 black-and-white photographs, 24 black-and-white negatives, 17 contact sheets, 1 print, 1 watercolor, and 2 chalk drawings), posters, and other materials detailing Chapin's musical career, especially performances of the Chapin Trio; notebooks and appointment books; and musical scores by Chapin and others. Also includes recordings on 17 reel-to-reel tapes, 8 CDs, and 5 audiocassette tapes of performances by Chapin and others; 3 electronic computer files; and 24 small musical instruments of plastic and metal. (01-0157)

The addition (2002-0281 and 2003-0125; 12,657 items, 50.5 linear feet) consists primarily of studio and demo recordings of Chapin's music on audiocassette, vinyl, and reel-to-reel tape. Also contains a number of collages by Chapin, documenting another of his forms of expression; personal items, especially photographs and correspondence, reflecting his close relationships with family and friends; videos and film reels of recording sessions, tours, and other events, including Chapin's memorial service; sheet music and music books; clothing and hats; 3 hand instruments; performance posters; and business items.

separatedmaterial.head: Materials Cataloged Separately
separatedmaterial.p: The following 11 books were removed from the collection (accession 2001-0157) and cataloged separately.

list.item: Glen Alyn, I Say Me for a Parable: The Oral Autobiography of Mance Lipscomb, Texas Bluesman, Da Capo Press, 1993.
Miles Davis with Quincy Troupe, Miles: The Autobiography, Simon and Schuster, 1989.
Vernon Frazer, Relic's Reunions, Beneath the Underground Books, 2000.
Vernon Frazer, Demolition Fedora, Potes & Poets Press Inc., 2000.
Vernon Frazer, Improvisations (I-XXIV), Beneath the Underground Books, 2000.
Vernon Frazer, Sing Me One Song of Evolution, Echolalia Press in association with Beneath the Underground Books, 1998.
Vernon Frazer, A Slick Set of Wheels, Water Row Press, 1987. [Loose materials from inside the book can be found in box 35 of accession 2001-0157 of the Thomas Chapin Papers.]
Vernon Frazer, Stay Tuned to This Channel and other stories, Beneath the Underground Books, 1999.
Lloyd NcNeill, Black Line, Baobab Record Company, 1983.
Charles Mingus, Beneath the Underdog, Penguin Books, 1971.
Herschel Silverman and Steven Dalachinsky, Intervalsss: the poems and words of musicians, Beehive Press and Sisyphus Press, 2000.

did.unittitle: Reel-to-Reel tapes recorded by Thomas Chapin Trio

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Current reel numbers correspond to original reel numbers. All reels contain the following production information: Client: Musso; Producer: R.M.; Engineer: R.M.; Speed: 30 IPS; Tape: 996; Level: +6/185; Asst.: Mike; Auto: Tones on [R1]. Tracking sheets accompanying the reels are in box 35.
Need more processing before use: Make use copies of all reels.
